summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from June-July 2020 discussing the recruitment of agents to assist with a 'taint review' in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show coordination between FBI field offices to secure personnel for this high-profile investigation.

persons.name: Corey
persons.context: Addressed in an email from another FBI agent (TD) volunteering for the taint review. Appears to be a point of contact in the New York Field Office.

connections.description: Both are FBI Special Agents involved in the Epstein case, with SA being the case agent and Corey being a contact in the New York Field Office.

events.title: Request for Taint Review Assistance
events.description: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit sends an initial email requesting assistance for a taint review related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Volunteer Offer for Taint Review
events.description: An FBI agent (TD) follows up, volunteering to assist with the taint review for the Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination for Training and Overview
events.description: FBI agents coordinate meeting times and locations (26 Federal Plaza, 9th floor) to provide an overview and set up access for the taint review work.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking personnel for a 'taint review' in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of June-July 2020.
The review was described as a 'unique opportunity to work on a high profile investigation'.
The case agent for the Epstein investigation is referred to as 'SA'.
The emails show internal FBI coordination between the New York Field Office and another field office (TD).
Access to a 'CAIR account' and the 'high side' (likely a secure network) was part of the setup for agents assisting with the review.
